name: recultivation, limestone mine | recultivation, limestone mine | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5449/documentation

The ratio of topsoil (assumed density: 1'400 kg/m3, thickness: 0.3 m, weight: 420 kg/m2, ) to extracted limestone (density: 2'300 kg/m3, thickness: 70m, weight: 160'000 kg/m2) is about 0.26%. The diesel fuel used for covering the closed mine is thus calculated using this ratio compared to its requirement during operation of the mine.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



includes only transformation from mineral extraction site to forest and the diesel consumption.

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: data are only from one company in Switzerland (KFN)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Recultivation topsoil thickness 30 cm for a medium-size Swiss limestone mine .
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: data which are only available for GLO have been used as proxy for CH This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
